description: A credit card is a type of payment card that lets you access credit on the go. It can either be a plastic or ametal cardissued by a bank or a financial institution. It allows you to pay for goods and services, both online and offline. If you pay off the credit card balance in full within the due date, you will not have to pay any interest on the due amount. Paying off your credit card bills on time will help you improve yourcredit score.

description: Credit Cards come with a range of features and benefits. You can earn rewards such as points or cashback on your purchases, enjoy travel perks such as access to airport lounges and travel insurance, and get protection for your purchases with extended warranties.

benefit_name: RuPay Credit Cards for UPI Transactions
description: RuPay, India's domestic card payment network, is the only payment network that offers credit card benefits for UPI transactions. The RBI permitted the linking of UPI apps withRuPay credit cardsin June 2022, enabling seamlesscredit card payments using UPIand earning rewards in the process.
Can I get a credit card online?Yes, you can apply for a credit card online on the credit card issuer’s website, or you can conveniently compare multiple cards and apply for one onBankBazaar.

Does my credit card number change when I renew?No, usually the number of the renewed card remains the same after expiry. But some bank issues new card with different number. On renewal theCVV numberand expiry date changes.

How do credit cards work?A credit card gives you a line of credit; you can use this to make purchases, cash advances and balance transfers. You will have to pay back the amount by the due date specified by the bank. You have the option to pay the minimum amount, any amount more than that, or the total amount due.

What is the meaning of a Credit Card Limit?The credit limit is the maximum amount one can spend on their card. A higher credit limit will allow you to spend more, and can also help improve yourcredit score.

What Does a Negative Credit Card Balance Mean?Anegative credit card balancereflects excess funds in your credit card account rather than debt. While it may look unusual, it is not a problem and can even work in your favor.

How can I get a card for the first time?If you already have a credit history, you can check your eligibility, choose a card that suits your lifestyle needs and apply for it on BankBazaar. If you do not have a credit history, you can opt for asecure credit card, usually offeredagainst fixed deposits.
What is the minimum credit score for getting a card?A credit score above 750 is ideal for getting a credit card.
Can I get a credit card in one day?Yes. Due to the online application system, your credit card application could be approved in one day. However, you may not get the physical credit card in one day.
Can I get a credit card without a job?Even if you do not have a job and have a substantial cash inflow into your account every month, you may be eligible for a credit card.
Do credit cards come with airport lounge benefits?Yes, many credit cards offer complimentary access to domestic and international airport lounges.

What does 'minimum due' mean on a credit card statement?Theminimum amount dueis the minimum amount a credit cardholder needs to pay in case they cannot pay the total outstanding. It is typically 5% of the total outstanding amount on the card.

Can I get a credit card with a bad credit score?Credit scores above 750 are generally deemed suitable for credit card approvals. Scores below 750 are usually considered poor, and approval may be subject to pledging a collateral as security (collateral such asfixed deposits).

Can I use my credit card in other countries?It depends on your card type. If your credit card is accepted globally, you can use it in other countries, as mentioned by your card issuer. However, a foreign transaction fee may be charged for all purchases abroad.
Do I need to pay a processing fee for a loan against a credit card?Yes, banks do charge processing fees forloans against credit cards. However, you need to pay a very nominal processing fee.

What are the charges for withdrawing cash using my credit card?Different banks will charge different fees. Typically, the charge will range from 2.5% to 3% of your transaction amount. There will be a minimum amount of Rs.250 to Rs.500.

If I make a late payment on my credit card, will it affect my credit score?It depends on various factors - the number of days late, the number of instances, and the amount due. Based on all this, your credit card issuer would decide whether to report the same to the credit agencies.
What should I do when my credit card is lost?When you lose your credit card, you need to notify the bank immediately, and they will block your account.

How do I reach credit card customer care?You can reach abank's credit card customer careby calling their customer care number or by sending an email to them. You may also contact them though chat support or WhatsApp support.

Can I get a credit card without a credit score?Yes, you may be able to get a secured credit card without having a credit score. However, the bank will charge a higher fee. Usually, banks accept a CIBIL score of 700-750 and above to issue a card.

How does the card issuer decide my credit limit?The credit card issuer will decide the credit limit for your card by looking into a lot of factors, like your repayment history, credit score, monthly income, total debt, etc.
Are there any charges for international purchases made with credit cards?Yes, you might be charged a fee of 1% to 4% of the transaction amount for international transactions.

They also offer the flexibility to pay off balances over time and provide fraud protection. Overall, they provide convenience and extra advantages for consumers.
Many banks offer a welcome gift to new credit card applicants once the card is issued through bonus reward points, vouchers, discounts, and other benefits.
They generally offer a reward program, which allows cardholders toearn reward pointson every transaction they make using their cards.
Credit cards offer a grace period of up to 50 days during which the bank does not charge any interest on the outstanding card balance.
Banks offer a fuel surcharge waiver to the cardholders on spending a specific amount of money on fuel every month.
Many credit cards offer cashback on daily spending and help the cardholder save money.
Cardholders can enjoy various lifestyle benefits on their credit cards, such as offers on dining, shopping, wellness, entertainment, and other benefits.
Travel benefits of these cards include air miles,airport lounge access, travel insurance, airline offers, hotel offers, and other benefits.
Some cards offer complimentary airport lounge access to cardholders. The offer varies from one bank to another.
Cardholders canapply for add-on cardsfor their immediate family members and share the benefits of their card.
Some premier cards come with a comprehensive insurance policy that provides coverage against air accidents, life, lost baggage, lost card, outstanding, and other benefits.
Cardholders can transfer the outstanding balance of their existing cards issued by one bank to the credit card account of another bank and pay off the balance at a lower interest rate.
Today, most credit cards that are issued in India areinternational cardsand are accepted by various merchants all over the world.
This feature allows the cardholders to convert their transactions into easy monthly instalments (EMIs).
Owning a credit card helps you build a healthycredit scoreor aCIBIL score. By making timely payments on your card and in full, you can build your credit history and improve your credit score.
Credit cards offer the maximum amount that the cardholders can spend on their card.
Safeguards the card from unauthorised transactions.
Some cards charge annual fees that come with added benefits and a spend-based annual fee waiver facility.
A Low Annual Percentage Rate (APR) is advantageous for large purchases or balance transfer.

You must provide identification, address proof, income proof, and other necessary documents when applying. Pay your Bill on Time & in Full:Be sure to pay your credit card bills in full and on time to maintain a good credit score and avoid higher interest charges. If full payment is not possible, try to pay more than the minimum to reduce interest costs.

Convert Large Purchases into EMIs:You can choose to convert any high-value purchase amount into EMIs. This helps in breaking down the expense into smaller, manageable payments, often at a lower interest rate than regular credit card charges.

Avoid Withdrawing Cash using your Credit Card:Cash advances attract interest from the moment you withdraw, with no interest-free period. Additionally, high fees can lead to unnecessary debt. Use this option only in emergencies.

Track your Spending Regularly:Make sure you are aware of your credit card spending by keeping track of your credit card bill statements and SMS alters by the bank. This will help you manage your spending habits. Keep checking your credit report at regular intervals to avoid any discrepancies.

Limit Multiple Credit Card Applications:Applying for several credit cards at once can lower your credit score by opening multiple hard inquiries. Instead, analyse your choice of cards based on your spending patterns and financial needs.
Check your rewards:Check details about the card benefits and reward programme.
Trusted merchants:Minimise the risk of misuse of your credit card, use trusted merchants or retailers.
Can I get a credit card online?Yes, you can apply for a credit card online on the credit card issuer’s website, or you can conveniently compare multiple cards and apply for one onBankBazaar.

Does my credit card number change when I renew?No, usually the number of the renewed card remains the same after expiry. But some bank issues new card with different number. On renewal theCVV numberand expiry date changes.

How do credit cards work?A credit card gives you a line of credit; you can use this to make purchases, cash advances and balance transfers. You will have to pay back the amount by the due date specified by the bank. You have the option to pay the minimum amount, any amount more than that, or the total amount due.

What is the meaning of a Credit Card Limit?The credit limit is the maximum amount one can spend on their card. A higher credit limit will allow you to spend more, and can also help improve yourcredit score.

What Does a Negative Credit Card Balance Mean?Anegative credit card balancereflects excess funds in your credit card account rather than debt. While it may look unusual, it is not a problem and can even work in your favor.

How can I get a card for the first time?If you already have a credit history, you can check your eligibility, choose a card that suits your lifestyle needs and apply for it on BankBazaar. If you do not have a credit history, you can opt for asecure credit card, usually offeredagainst fixed deposits.
What is the minimum credit score for getting a card?A credit score above 750 is ideal for getting a credit card.
Can I get a credit card in one day?Yes. Due to the online application system, your credit card application could be approved in one day. However, you may not get the physical credit card in one day.
Can I get a credit card without a job?Even if you do not have a job and have a substantial cash inflow into your account every month, you may be eligible for a credit card.
Do credit cards come with airport lounge benefits?Yes, many credit cards offer complimentary access to domestic and international airport lounges.

What does 'minimum due' mean on a credit card statement?Theminimum amount dueis the minimum amount a credit cardholder needs to pay in case they cannot pay the total outstanding. It is typically 5% of the total outstanding amount on the card.

Can I get a credit card with a bad credit score?Credit scores above 750 are generally deemed suitable for credit card approvals. Scores below 750 are usually considered poor, and approval may be subject to pledging a collateral as security (collateral such asfixed deposits).

Can I use my credit card in other countries?It depends on your card type. If your credit card is accepted globally, you can use it in other countries, as mentioned by your card issuer. However, a foreign transaction fee may be charged for all purchases abroad.
Do I need to pay a processing fee for a loan against a credit card?Yes, banks do charge processing fees forloans against credit cards. However, you need to pay a very nominal processing fee.

What are the charges for withdrawing cash using my credit card?Different banks will charge different fees. Typically, the charge will range from 2.5% to 3% of your transaction amount. There will be a minimum amount of Rs.250 to Rs.500.

If I make a late payment on my credit card, will it affect my credit score?It depends on various factors - the number of days late, the number of instances, and the amount due. Based on all this, your credit card issuer would decide whether to report the same to the credit agencies.
What should I do when my credit card is lost?When you lose your credit card, you need to notify the bank immediately, and they will block your account.

How do I reach credit card customer care?You can reach abank's credit card customer careby calling their customer care number or by sending an email to them. You may also contact them though chat support or WhatsApp support.

Can I get a credit card without a credit score?Yes, you may be able to get a secured credit card without having a credit score. However, the bank will charge a higher fee. Usually, banks accept a CIBIL score of 700-750 and above to issue a card.

How does the card issuer decide my credit limit?The credit card issuer will decide the credit limit for your card by looking into a lot of factors, like your repayment history, credit score, monthly income, total debt, etc.
Are there any charges for international purchases made with credit cards?Yes, you might be charged a fee of 1% to 4% of the transaction amount for international transactions.

Rewards on every transaction:You can earn reward points on most of the transactions done with yourcredit card. Only a few transactions such as gold, fuel, cash advances, fees and charges are not eligible for reward points. A minimum amount should be spent on each transaction to become eligible for reward points. The same points, after reaching a cut off, can be redeemed for rewards and other gifts from the bank's rewards catalogue.

Accelerated rewards:Not only can cardholders earn reward points for minimum spends, but also earn accelerated reward points on selected categories of spends. The categories eligible for accelerated reward points differ from one card to another and are mostly based on the credit card type. Inco-branded credit cards, more rewards points will be offered on purchases related to credit card partner's product or services. For instance, aco-branded fuel credit cardwill offer more reward points on fuel transactions compared to regular transactions.

Milestone rewards:For reaching certain milestones with respect tocredit card transactionsor spends, the bank will offer a bundle of reward points as a milestone bonus. Cardholders can earn a huge lot of reward points by achieving such milestones.

Exciting rewards:After accruing a certain number of reward points, cardholders will be eligible to redeem the same for various categories of products listed in the company's rewards catalogue. Each bank has its own rewards catalogue that features products including electronics, home appliances, apparels, etc. Some cards will also provide an option to redeem rewards points for cash against the outstanding on the card.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: Can I club the offer with other offers on the website or banks?No, credit card offers cannot be clubbed with other offers available on websites or banks.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: How to check credit card offers?The latest credit card offers can be checked on the specific bank's official website. Click on the option 'Credit card offers and discount' to check the offer's eligibility and validity.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: What is a pre-approved credit card offer?Pre-approved credit card offer is an online credit card offer which is offered by the bank depending upon yourCIBIL score. If the candidate's CIBIL score is good, then the candidate is eligible for the applicable online credit card offer. This does not mean a new credit card will be offered. Candidates only get an invitation to the apply link to avail the offer.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: What are the ways to redeem credit card reward points?Reward points on credit cards can be redeemed by enchasing the reward points, by purchasing gifts from the partner companies, and by purchasing gifts from the credit card company itself.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: How can I know which offers are available on my credit card?You can check the official website or app of your credit card issuer. Some credit cards also provide alerts on SMS or emails. You can subscribe to the alerts or contact customer service for the latest deals and ongoing promotions.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: Are there spending limits or minimum spending conditions to avail myself of the offers?Yes, most credit card offers have minimum transaction values and caps on rewards or cashback. Always check the offer terms before making a purchase.

benefit_name: FAQs on Latest Credit Card Offers
description: Are credit card offers valid on supplementary or add-on cards?Yes, in most cases, offers are valid on both primary and add-on cards, but they usually count towards the same account’s spending limit or reward cap.

Can I club the offer with other offers on the website or banks?No, credit card offers cannot be clubbed with other offers available on websites or banks.

How to check credit card offers?The latest credit card offers can be checked on the specific bank's official website. Click on the option 'Credit card offers and discount' to check the offer's eligibility and validity.

What is a pre-approved credit card offer?Pre-approved credit card offer is an online credit card offer which is offered by the bank depending upon yourCIBIL score. If the candidate's CIBIL score is good, then the candidate is eligible for the applicable online credit card offer. This does not mean a new credit card will be offered. Candidates only get an invitation to the apply link to avail the offer.

What are the ways to redeem credit card reward points?Reward points on credit cards can be redeemed by enchasing the reward points, by purchasing gifts from the partner companies, and by purchasing gifts from the credit card company itself.

How can I know which offers are available on my credit card?You can check the official website or app of your credit card issuer. Some credit cards also provide alerts on SMS or emails. You can subscribe to the alerts or contact customer service for the latest deals and ongoing promotions.

Are there spending limits or minimum spending conditions to avail myself of the offers?Yes, most credit card offers have minimum transaction values and caps on rewards or cashback. Always check the offer terms before making a purchase.

Are credit card offers valid on supplementary or add-on cards?Yes, in most cases, offers are valid on both primary and add-on cards, but they usually count towards the same account’s spending limit or reward cap.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: How can I increase the limit of my HDFC credit card?You can send a signed letter and request for increasing yourcredit card limit. You will have to also submit your income proofs. If you are a salaried person, then, you will have to also attach a self-attested copy of a recent salary slip.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Can I apply for an HDFC credit card online? What benefits can I get?Yes, you can apply for an HDFC credit card online, getting an e-approval in just three easy steps. Additionally, online applicants can enjoy special offers like lifetime free credit cards, Rs 250 cashback and 5X rewards points on purchases for the first three months.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What is the minimum salary I require to have an HDFC credit card?You will need to have a minimum salary of Rs.12,000 per month if you are a salaried person. If you are self-employed, you will need to have Rs.2 lakh per annum as your salary. You will also have to maintain a good credit score.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: My HDFC credit card application is in process. Can I track the status online?Yes, your credit card application status can be instantly got on the HDFC web portal by providing your application reference number, mobile number or date of birth.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Are HDFC Bank credit card statements available online?Yes,HDFC credit card statementsup to a period of six months can be viewed online by using the Credit Card Net Banking feature.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What are the documents required to complete my HDFC credit card application online?Applicant's address details, PAN card, Scanned copy of your ID proof and address proof

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: I am looking to transfer my existing credit card balance to a HDFC credit card. Is that possible?Yes, you can transfer your outstanding balance from any other bank's credit card to your new or existing HDFC Bank credit card and complete the payments with flexible EMI options.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What does the SmartEMI scheme offer to a customer?The Smart EMI scheme allows you to easily convert your credit card purchases into monthly instalments with flexible tenures and attractive interest rates.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Can I own two HDFC credit cards at once?Mostly, banks do not issue two credit cards to one person. However, if you have a good credit score, the bank may consider issuing two credit cards to you.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What is the advantage of paying my HDFC credit card bill using internet banking?Customers can make online credit card payments free of charge, and also from other non-HDFC Bank accounts.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Does HDFC Bank offer the option of converting accrued rewards points into Air-miles or Airline E-Vouchers?Yes, HDFC credit card holders do have the option of converting their accumulated rewards points into Air-miles or Airline e-vouchers online. The number of reward points available currently for redemption can be obtained from a customer's credit card statement.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What does the Late Payment Fee on Credit Cards entail?Failing to pay the minimum amount due on your Credit Card by the due date of payment will result in the imposition of a late payment fee. Consistent instances of late payments may have an impact on your Credit Rating.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Can I take a loan using the HDFC Bank credit card I currently hold?Yes, if you are an existing HDFC Bank credit card holder, there are two pre-approved loans offered - Insta Loan, within your credit card limit and Insta Jumbo Loan, available above the credit limit of your card.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: How can cardholders make use of their reward points?After accumulating Reward Points, cardholders have the option to redeem them for various items available in the rewards catalogue, including gift vouchers, flight tickets, hotel bookings, and more, all accessible through NetBanking.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: What are the regulations regarding interest payments for Credit Card purchases?Interest charges are not incurred on all purchases. However, suppose you fail to clear the total outstanding amount on or before the bill's due date. In that case, any unpaid dues and subsequent transactions will begin to accrue interest until the outstanding amount is fully settled.

benefit_name: FAQs on HDFC Bank Credit Card
description: Can existing Credit Cardholders apply for an additional one?Individuals who already possess a Credit Card can readily apply for an HDFC Bank Credit Card, provided that their existing Credit Card is from another bank, and they maintain a favourable Credit Score. However, if they already hold an HDFC Bank Credit Card, they will not be eligible for an additional HDFC Bank Credit Card.

description: Do I need to settle Credit Card bills if my Card goes unused?HDFC Bank Credit Cards come with specific charges that must be paid, irrespective of card usage. Welcome Perks:Experience exclusive advantages upon registration and making transactions with an HDFC Bank Credit Card. Additional benefits are available for annual expenditures that surpass specified thresholds.

Smart EMI:Transform credit card purchases of Rs. 2,500 or more into SmartEMIs following your transactions. Benefit from the competitive rate of interest and flexible repayment periods for offline and online Credit Card purchases converted into SmartEMI.

Contactless Payments:Conveniently, confidently, and securely execute payments using ourcontactless Credit Cards. Merely tap your card for swift payments at retail establishments within seconds. To enable contactless payments, kindly utilise MyCards.
Foreign Currency Markup:Save more while shopping on your international expenses. We apply a minimal foreign currency markup on overseas transactions with specific HDFC Bank Credit Cards.
Insurance Benefits:Certain HDFC Bank Credit Cards offer complimentary insurance benefits, including substantial coverage for air accidents and emergency overseas hospitalisation.
Revolving Credit Facility:Take advantage of revolving credit facilities at nominal interest rates on HDFC Bank Credit Cards.
Airport Lounge Access:Enjoy complimentaryairport lounge accessat both domestic and international airports with select credit cards.

Zero Lost Card Liability:In the event of a lost Credit Card, promptly report it to our 24-hour call centre. You will be exempt from liabilities forfraudulent transactionsupon timely reporting. Learn more about the advantages of using a credit card.
Discounts:You can avail exclusive discounts, reward points, and offers.
Fraud Protection:In case you suspect credit card fraud, just notify your bank, and your credit card will be instantly blocked.
Multiple Credit Cards:HDFC Bank offers multiple credit cards and you can choose one that suits your requirements.
Credit Score Improvement:You canimprove your credit scoreby timely and full payment of bills and keeping credit utilisation less than 30%.

Visit the official website of HDFC.
Navigate to the 'Credit Cards' section and select a credit card based on your preference.
Check the eligibility criteria and documents required for the credit card.
Apply online by entering all the requested details. You can also submit your credit card application along with relevant documents at an HDFC branch or ATM.
You will receive your credit card on your communication address once the bank approves your application.
When it is delivered, you will have to sign for it and provide proof of identity.
You will receive the personal identity number (PIN) via courier while the Green PIN will be sent on your registered mobile number.
This PIN is required to authenticate anycredit card transactions.
Visit the nearest HDFC ATM to change the PIN.
Customers need to login into NetBanking with their customer ID and internet password.
Inside the Net Banking account, click on the credit card tab.
Add your new card, by selecting the 'Register New Card' feature.
Enter your card credentials like credit card number, credit card ATM PIN, expiry date and click on 'Submit'.
Add the HDFC WhatsApp number (70-700-222-22) to your contacts.
Send a WhatsApp message 'Manage My Credit Card' to that number.
You will receive a message with several options.
Select the 'Online (E-Commerce) Transactions' option. You will need to enter the number under which the option is available.
An OTP will be sent to the registered mobile number, enter it.
Next, the last four digits of the credit card number must be entered.
An option will be provided to activate online transactions.

Rewards Points System:HDFC Bank offers arewards pointssystem for both offline and online Credit Card transactions, providing a significant advantage. You can redeem these accrued points for a variety of rewards from our catalogue, gift vouchers from renowned brands, and airline miles, or offset them against your statement balance. Select Credit Cards that can earn you higher reward points. It's essential to utilise your reward points before they expire and keep an eye out for exclusive Credit Card offers linked to your reward points.

Credit Card Statement:As a result, HDFC Bank issues monthly credit card statements that outline all transactions conducted during a credit cycle, including the amounts charged, the due date, and outstanding balances. These statements are generated on a fixed date, which may not necessarily be the first day of the month and are sent to your registered email address.

Credit Card Cash Withdrawal:You can utilise your Credit Card to withdraw cash from ATMs through our Credit Card cash advance facility. The permissible cash withdrawal limits depend on your card type and differ from the credit limit. The bank applies credit card interest rates and other applicable fees to Credit Card cash withdrawals.

Fees & Charges:HDFC Bank imposes specific Credit Card fees depending on the type of Credit Card you hold. These fees include an annual maintenance charge, cash advance fees for withdrawals, foreign currency markup fees, late payment charges, interest on outstanding dues, over-limit fees, and GST charges.

Credit Card Bill Payment:HDFC Bank generates a new bill each month according to your credit cycle. You have approximately 20 days after the bill generation date, along with aninterest-freeperiod of about 50 days. It is necessary to make at least the minimum amount due. No additional charges are levied by the bank if you pay your outstanding dues in full on or before the due date. However, interest is applicable for partial or non-payments. You also have the option to set up automatic Credit Card payments through standing instructions from your Savings Account.

Card Features and Usage:Your Credit Card contains essential details, including your card number, name, expiration date, and CVV number, which are required when making online transactions. For added security, you must enter a 4-digit PIN and a One Time Password (OTP) sent to your registered mobile number (RMN) by the bank to authenticate the transaction. Ensure the safety of your transactions by refraining from sharing your PIN or OTP with anyone.

Overseas Usage:You have the option to activate your card for international use at any time. However, it is advisable to deactivate this feature once you return to India. If you lose your card or suspect any fraudulent or suspicious activities on your card, promptly notify us. In such cases, the bank will immediately block the card to prevent unauthorised usage.

Avoid Sharing Card Details:Exercise caution when responding to communications that request your card number, expiry date, or other sensitive information. While certain values may be required when you contact us through our helpline, remember that HDFC Bank or its representatives will never ask you for your Credit Card PIN, CVV, or OTPs. Under no circumstances should you share this information with anyone.

How can I increase the limit of my HDFC credit card?You can send a signed letter and request for increasing yourcredit card limit. You will have to also submit your income proofs. If you are a salaried person, then, you will have to also attach a self-attested copy of a recent salary slip.

Can I apply for an HDFC credit card online? What benefits can I get?Yes, you can apply for an HDFC credit card online, getting an e-approval in just three easy steps. Additionally, online applicants can enjoy special offers like lifetime free credit cards, Rs 250 cashback and 5X rewards points on purchases for the first three months.

What is the minimum salary I require to have an HDFC credit card?You will need to have a minimum salary of Rs.12,000 per month if you are a salaried person. If you are self-employed, you will need to have Rs.2 lakh per annum as your salary. You will also have to maintain a good credit score.

My HDFC credit card application is in process. Can I track the status online?Yes, your credit card application status can be instantly got on the HDFC web portal by providing your application reference number, mobile number or date of birth.
Are HDFC Bank credit card statements available online?Yes,HDFC credit card statementsup to a period of six months can be viewed online by using the Credit Card Net Banking feature.
What are the documents required to complete my HDFC credit card application online?Applicant's address details, PAN card, Scanned copy of your ID proof and address proof

I am looking to transfer my existing credit card balance to a HDFC credit card. Is that possible?Yes, you can transfer your outstanding balance from any other bank's credit card to your new or existing HDFC Bank credit card and complete the payments with flexible EMI options.

What does the SmartEMI scheme offer to a customer?The Smart EMI scheme allows you to easily convert your credit card purchases into monthly instalments with flexible tenures and attractive interest rates.
Can I own two HDFC credit cards at once?Mostly, banks do not issue two credit cards to one person. However, if you have a good credit score, the bank may consider issuing two credit cards to you.
What is the advantage of paying my HDFC credit card bill using internet banking?Customers can make online credit card payments free of charge, and also from other non-HDFC Bank accounts.

Does HDFC Bank offer the option of converting accrued rewards points into Air-miles or Airline E-Vouchers?Yes, HDFC credit card holders do have the option of converting their accumulated rewards points into Air-miles or Airline e-vouchers online. The number of reward points available currently for redemption can be obtained from a customer's credit card statement.

What does the Late Payment Fee on Credit Cards entail?Failing to pay the minimum amount due on your Credit Card by the due date of payment will result in the imposition of a late payment fee. Consistent instances of late payments may have an impact on your Credit Rating.

Can I take a loan using the HDFC Bank credit card I currently hold?Yes, if you are an existing HDFC Bank credit card holder, there are two pre-approved loans offered - Insta Loan, within your credit card limit and Insta Jumbo Loan, available above the credit limit of your card.

How can cardholders make use of their reward points?After accumulating Reward Points, cardholders have the option to redeem them for various items available in the rewards catalogue, including gift vouchers, flight tickets, hotel bookings, and more, all accessible through NetBanking.

What are the regulations regarding interest payments for Credit Card purchases?Interest charges are not incurred on all purchases. However, suppose you fail to clear the total outstanding amount on or before the bill's due date. In that case, any unpaid dues and subsequent transactions will begin to accrue interest until the outstanding amount is fully settled.

Can existing Credit Cardholders apply for an additional one?Individuals who already possess a Credit Card can readily apply for an HDFC Bank Credit Card, provided that their existing Credit Card is from another bank, and they maintain a favourable Credit Score. However, if they already hold an HDFC Bank Credit Card, they will not be eligible for an additional HDFC Bank Credit Card.

Do I need to settle Credit Card bills if my Card goes unused?HDFC Bank Credit Cards come with specific charges that must be paid, irrespective of card usage. However, under certain circumstances, these charges can be waived. To learn about the conditions for potential waivers, please click here.

With YES Bank - BankBazaar Co-branded Credit Card, the reward points that you earn can be shared with friends and family.
With this credit card, the reward points that you convert into cash will be directly credited to your savings account.
Can I use my YES BANK credit card for withdrawing money?Yes, you can use the YES BANK credit card and withdraw cash from the ATMs.
Are there any YES BANK credit cards which do not have any joining fees?Yes, the FinBooster: YES BANK -BankBazaar Co-branded Credit Card does not charge you any joining fees.

How can I pay the bill of my YES BANK Credit Card?You can use the YES BANK net banking and YES BANK mobile banking facility to pay the credit card bill. You can also go to the bank and write out a cheque for the same.

How do I check the status of my YES BANK credit card?Visit  application-status menu in the official website and type in your 13-digit unique application reference number. You can also call 1800 103 1212.

How do I get the PIN for my YES BANK credit card?You can set the PIN for your YES BANK credit card by logging in to your net banking account and clicking on the 'Credit Card' tab on the top of the screen. You would be directed to a page where all your registered credit cards would be listed.

Are there any YES BANK cards issued against a fixed deposit?Yes, there is one card issued against a fixed deposit - YES Prosperity Rewards Plus Card. You will require a minimum deposit amount of Rs.50,000 with the bank to be eligible.

benefit_name: Top RBL Bank Credit Cards in India 2026
description: The credit cards offered by RBL bank are as given below:

benefit_name: Features and Benefits of RBL Bank Credit Cards
description: The below-listed are some of the features of RBL Bank credit cards:

RBL BankBazaar SaveMax credit card is designed for individuals who wish to save on everyday expenses. This credit card offers various benefits like reward points, cashbacks, and free credit advisory report from BankBazaar every month.

benefit_name: RBL Bank BankBazaar SaveMax Credit Card
description: RBL BankBazaar SaveMax credit card is designed for individuals who wish to save on everyday expenses. This credit card offers various benefits like reward points, cashbacks, and free credit advisory report from BankBazaar every month.

benefit_name: RBL Bank BankBazaar SaveMax Pro Credit Card
description: The SaveMax credit card offered by RBL Bank in partnership with BankBazaar is an invite-only card, designed for individuals who wish to save while spending. This credit card comes with various benefits like reward points, discounts, and cashbacks.
The RBL Bank ShopRite credit card is an entry-level credit card offered at Rs.500. This credit card offers various benefits like reward points, discounts on movie tickets, fuel surcharge waiver, etc.

The Maxima credit card offered by RBL Bank is a lifestyle credit card and offers various benefits on dining, travel, movies and grocery spends. This credit card is offered at an annual membership fee of Rs.2,000 and offers reward points, cashbacks, discounts, and much more.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Maxima Plus Card
description: The RBL Bank Platinum Maxima Plus credit card is a lifestyle credit card offered at an annual fee of Rs.2,500 plus taxes. This credit card is designed for individuals who wish to save while indulging in dinner or entertainment.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Bonus Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank Platinum Bonus Credit Card offers an attractive welcome experience with 6,000 bonus reward points on meeting the initial spend criteria. Along with this, the card provides the benefit of an annual fee waiver from the second year if you spend Rs.1 lakh in a year.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Travel & Lifestyle Credit Cards
description: The RBL Bank Insignia Preferred Banking Credit Card is a premium offering designed for individuals seeking luxury. This credit card offers a host of benefits like reward points, discounts, dining privileges, luxury hotel stays, etc.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Insignia Preferred Banking Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank Insignia Preferred Banking Credit Card is a premium offering designed for individuals seeking luxury. This credit card offers a host of benefits like reward points, discounts, dining privileges, luxury hotel stays, etc.

The RBL Bank Icon credit card is a premium offering designed for individuals seeking luxury. This credit card caters to your various lifestyle needs like discounts on travel bookings, movie benefits, dining offers, concierge services, etc.

benefit_name: RBL Bank World Safari Credit Card
description: The Safari credit card offered by RBL Bank is designed for travellers and comes with an annual fee of Rs.3,000. This credit card offers various benefits on like travel insurance, reward points, concierge services, milestone rewards, and 0% markup fee on foreign transactions.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum TravelEasy Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank Platinum TravelEasy credit card is designed for individuals who wish to save on travel and fuel transactions. This credit card offers various benefits on Ola/Uber bookings, fuel transactions, and other rewards.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Plus Credit Card
description: The Platinum Plus credit card offered by RBL Bank is a lifestyle credit card and offers various benefits on shopping, entertainment, grocery, electronics, automobiles, etc.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Edge Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank Platinum Edge credit card offers its customers high-end savings on daily transactions like grocery, electronics, fashion, automobile, etc. This credit card also offers various complimentary benefits like airport lounge access, buy one get one movie ticket offers, fuel surcharge waiver, etc.

The RBL Bank World Prime SuperCard is a premium credit card that offers benefits on movies, online spending, airport lounge access,  assistance with golf course referrals and a unique emergency loan facility.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Max Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank World Max SuperCard is a premium lifestyle card that offers a combination of reward points for everyday spending, milestone bonuses, and lifestyle benefits like lounge access and movie ticket discounts.

benefit_name: RBL Bank Platinum Classic Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank Platinum Classic SuperCard is a foundational credit card that offers a "4-in-1" value proposition combining the features of a credit card, a debit card, a cash card, and an EMI card.

benefit_name: RBL Bank World Max Credit Card
description: The RBL Bank World Max credit card is a premium lifestyle card that offers a combination of reward points for everyday spending, milestone bonuses, and lifestyle benefits like lounge access and movie ticket discounts.

What should I do in case I lose my RBL Bank Credit Card?If you lose your RBL Bank credit card, immediately contact the 24-hour toll-free customer care provided by RBL Bank. Report the lost or stolen card to customer care. Once this is done, you will not be held liable for any transactions made on your card after.

Which RBL Bank credit card offers a pre-approved loan without any documentation required?You can get a pre-approved loan without any documentation required with theRBL Bank BankBazaar SaveMax Credit Card.

Where can I use my RBL Bank Credit Card?You can use an RBL Bank credit card domestically and internationally. The card is valid at any merchant and ATM which accepts MasterCard, Maestro, and Cirrus. You can also use your card to shop online.

What are the credit and cash advance limits available on RBL Bank Credit Cards?Your eligible credit limit depends on the card of your choice and your income bracket. Your cash limit will be a percentage of the available or total credit limit. This limit will be indicated on the billing statement of your credit card every month.

Why do I need add-on cards?Add-on cards can be taken for your family members which include only your spouse, parents, and children. You can share the benefits and convenience of a credit card with your family members. These cards will be issued under the primary card. All charges will be billed to the primary card.RBL Credit Card Reward pointsaccumulated will also be credited to the main card. You have full control over these cards as to the credit limit you would like to allow for each add-on card.

In addition to Reward Points and value back, you can enjoy a range ofoffers on your SBI card. From promotions on travel to shopping, get exclusive discounts and deals with your credit card.

Most SBI cards allow you to earnShop-and-Smile Reward Pointswhich have a validity of 2 years. Use your card to make purchases to earn points on each transaction. It is important to keep in mind the specific spend categories for which you can earn maximum Reward Points.

Is it possible to request an increase in the credit limit on my SBI credit card?You can request a credit limit increase using the SBI Card App, the SBI Card website, or the customer care line, if your card was issued with the option to request this. SBI may request updated income documents and/or proof of work and/or employment unless they make you a pre-approved increase offer.

Is there a way to check my available limit, statement, and current balances?All of your information can be seen through the SBI Card mobile app, or the SBI Card website dashboard. Additionally, you can inquire about your balance via SMS and/or the customer care representative.

What are the consequences of not paying my SBI credit card bill on time?Failure to pay your bill on time will incur both a late payment fee and finance charges, based on your remaining balance. Your future interest-free period for purchases may also be negatively impacted. In addition, missing payment deadlines repeatedly can diminish your credit score.

Can I convert large transactions into EMIs using my SBI credit card?Yes, SBI allows you to convert eligible spends into instalments using the SBI Card app, the SBI Card website, or by calling the SBI Card helpline. The tenure usually ranges from 3 months to 36 months and the applicable interest and processing fee will be applicable if you convert transactions into your EMIs.

Can I transfer outstanding balances from other credit cards to my SBI credit card?Yes, the Balance Transfer facility allows you to transfer existing dues from other bank cards with a credit balance transfer to your SBI credit card for a preferential interest rate. Balance transfer can help you consolidate and reduce your interest.

What should I do if my SBI credit card disappears or is lost or stolen?You should block the card hosted on the app, website, or helpline as soon as possible to ensure it cannot be used by any unauthorized person. A replacement card will be issued for a fee stated in the bank's schedule if applicable. You may wish to file a police report for additional safety if you feel it is necessary.

Does SBI provide loans against my credit card?Yes, SBI may offer a loan to any cardholder under the Encash facility. Depending on the type of loan, cardholders could have funds within limit or outside of their credit limit. The amount approved for the loan would become your total debt. The amount of time will be based on the amount of the loan requested.

I upgraded my SBI credit card. What happens to my limit and reward points?Your limit usually stays the same unless you are granted an increase by SBI at the time of your upgrade. All the points you earned with your previous credit card will be transferred to your new upgraded card. The new benefits of your card will begin once the upgraded card is produced and used.

I made an error in a transaction. Can I cancel it or get a refund?SBI cannot directly cancel transactions after they have been authorized. You will need to contact the merchant for a reversal or raise a dispute if the charge is not accurate. If a refund is initiated by the merchant, it will show as a credit to your card.

How can I redeem my reward points that I have earned on my SBI credit card?You can redeem your points through the SBI Card app or website towards vouchers, merchandise, travel bookings, or statement credit (based on your card type). There may be minimum points that need to be redeemed. Some redemptions may include a small processing fee.

State Bank of India offers multiple credit cards to meet the financial needs of individual cardholders. SBI cards offer rewards for travel, shopping, dining, and more. You can also enjoy benefits like cashback and low-interest rates, among others. If you are looking for a newcredit card, take a look at the features and benefits of SBI cards to choose one that best suits you.

SBI cards are categorised aspremium cards, shopping andtravel cards, classic cards and exclusive cards. Each card is unique and has special offers like free movie tickets, concierge services, lounge access facilities, balance transfer facility, flexi payment in EMIs, reward points, online bills payment and many more.
Multiple card options including lifestyle, shopping, fuel, travel, premium, classic, and co-branded cards, helping users choose based on spending needs.
Earn reward points on daily expenses such as dining, groceries, fuel, online shopping, and travel, redeemable for vouchers, merchandise, and statement credit.

Cashback on select cards for online shopping, utility bills, and category-specific spends, helping reduce monthly expenses.
Convert major purchases into EMIs; FlexiPay allows EMI conversion post-purchase for better financial planning.
Transfer outstanding balances from other credit cards to SBI Card at lower interest rates to reduce repayment burden.

Full card control through SBI Card app & portal: track spending, redeem rewards, raise service requests, and pay bills.
Tap-to-pay support for faster secure payments without entering PIN for eligible amounts.

Zero-liability policy after reporting lost/stolen card; secure transaction monitoring and OTP-based authorisation.

Global acceptance, reward points on international spends, and foreign exchange mark-up on overseas transactions.
Supplementary cards for family members with shared limit and similar benefits.
Eligibility-based credit limit enhancement requests available online.
Complimentary insurance on select cards including travel accident cover, air accident cover, baggage loss and purchase protection.

SBI Card Unnati- You can apply for thiscredit card against a fixed deposit. You need to have an FD of Rs.25,000 or more with State Bank of India to be eligible.
The fees and charges applicable on SBI credit card are listed in the table below:
3.75% per month (45% per annum) on all unsecured SBI Credit Cards (except Shaurya)

You are required to submit proof of identity, address, and income while applying for a credit card. Here is a list of documents you can submit to prove your eligibility. Remember that this is not an exhaustive list and that the bank can ask you for additional documents.

Applying for an SBI credit card is easy. BankBazaar offers a paperless application for selected SBI cards. You can check your eligibility, upload the documents, and apply for a card within a few minutes through theBankBazaar website.
Additionally, you can log on to the SBI website and apply for a card online. SBI offers an online application for most of their cards.
Access SBI Card's official website and go to the Credit Cards section. You can view cards available for categories such as Shopping, Travel, Cashback, and Premium.
Read the features, eligibility, and fees of cards shown. Select the card that fits your spending habits and financial situation.
Once you are on the card page, click the 'Apply Now' button to commence your online application.
You will be asked for your name, date of birth, mobile number, email ID, and residence address. An OTP will be sent to you as verification of your mobile number.
You will give the type of employment (salaried or self-employed), the name of the company or organization, your monthly income, as well as other financial information.

You will enter your PAN information and select KYC mode which will be e-KYC Aadhaar based or physical KYC based on what is available. In the case of being prompted, you will upload identity proof, address proof, and income proof.
You can view all of the data you entered, agree to the terms, and submit the form. Based on the details you provided, you may or may not be able to show a preliminary approval decision immediately.
A representative may call you to collect documents for additional verification. If KYC is complete, your application will go through the final approval stage.
Once your application has been approved, the card will be issued and couriered to your registered address. Information around tracking, and how to activate your card will be shared.
You can check the status of your application by entering your application reference number using the ‘Track Application’ facility on the SBI Card website until the card has been delivered to you.

You can also visit any SBI branch near you to apply for a credit card. If you want to apply for an SBI banking partner card, you will have to visit the partner branch to complete the application process.

SBI takes into account your credit history and yourcredit scoreto determine your eligibility for a card. Although the specific score required varies from card to card, a score of 700 and above is considered good.
If you want to find out whether your application has been approved by the bank, you can use the Track Application feature on the BankBazaar website.
Note:You may contact the BankBazaar customer support department. This service assures applicants access to their application status without the need for a reference ID.
Step 2:You will find the 'Track My Application' link under the 'Apply' tab.
Step 3:Enter your application or reference number to get the details.
Step 4:You can also fill in your date of birth to track your application.

Pay the balance on your other credit cards with your SBI card. You can transfer the outstanding amount on other cards to your SBI card at a low rate of interest. TheSBI credit card balance transferfeature can help you save on the interest on multiple cards. SBI offers two balance transfer plans you can choose from:
TheEncash feature on SBI cardsallows you quick access to funds when you need it the most. It is a pre-approved facility that is offered to selected cardholders. Here are more details:
SBI offers various avenues to help youpay your SBI credit card billon time. Based on your convenience, you can choose to pay your bill online or in person.
Transfer funds from any non-SBI account using IFSC SBIN00CARDS. Suitable for customers of other banks; processing generally same day.
Make payments via the SBI Card website using net banking or debit card from any bank. Instant credit and receipt.
For Visa SBI cards; pay through your bank’s net banking portal using the Visa payment facility. Secure inter-bank option.
Pay using SBI internet banking. Supports instant and scheduled payments. Also available via SBI UNIPAY and select third-party apps using Mastercard platform.
Pay via net banking, mobile banking, or ATM of SBI, Bank of India, and Indian Overseas Bank. Useful for account holders of these banks.
Automatic deduction of monthly bill from your bank account. Suitable for ensuring timely payment and avoiding late fees. Requires a mandate setup.
Standing instruction for automatic debit from your SBI account each month. Choice of minimum due or total outstanding.
Pay using debit cards from major banks through SBI Card portal. Useful when net banking is unavailable.
Make payments, view statements, check unbilled transactions, and manage card settings within the app. Supports UPI, net banking, and debit card.
Pay credit card bills using the YONO app or website. Direct access to SBI account and card details; fast and secure.
Pay using UPI ID linked to any bank. Instant settlement; ideal for urgent payments or customers without net banking access.
Pay using your SBI debit card at any SBI ATM. Receipt issued upon payment; convenient for non-online users.
Deposit cheque in an automated drop box and receive instant acknowledgement. Faster processing than manual drop box.
Drop cheque in authorised collection box. Processing depends on cheque clearing timelines.
Pay via cash or cheque by visiting an SBI branch. Physical receipt issued; suitable for those preferring in-person service.
If you have any queries about your card, you can contactSBI credit card customer carefor assistance. You can contact the bank through any one of the following ways.
In addition to Reward Points and value back, you can enjoy a range ofoffers on your SBI card. From promotions on travel to shopping, get exclusive discounts and deals with your credit card.

Most SBI cards allow you to earnShop-and-Smile Reward Pointswhich have a validity of 2 years. Use your card to make purchases to earn points on each transaction. It is important to keep in mind the specific spend categories for which you can earn maximum Reward Points.

Once you have accumulated the points, you can redeem them for exclusive gifts, shopping vouchers, and more. Points redemption can be done on the SBI website or through the mobile app. Sign in with your login information and redeem your points for any of the products in the catalogue.
You can call the SBI card helpline1860 180 1290or39 02 02 02with your local STD code or write to them to redeem your points. Your gift will be delivered to the registered address.

You can request a credit limit increase using the SBI Card App, the SBI Card website, or the customer care line, if your card was issued with the option to request this. SBI may request updated income documents and/or proof of work and/or employment unless they make you a pre-approved increase offer.

All of your information can be seen through the SBI Card mobile app, or the SBI Card website dashboard. Additionally, you can inquire about your balance via SMS and/or the customer care representative.

Failure to pay your bill on time will incur both a late payment fee and finance charges, based on your remaining balance. Your future interest-free period for purchases may also be negatively impacted. In addition, missing payment deadlines repeatedly can diminish your credit score.

Yes, SBI allows you to convert eligible spends into instalments using the SBI Card app, the SBI Card website, or by calling the SBI Card helpline. The tenure usually ranges from 3 months to 36 months and the applicable interest and processing fee will be applicable if you convert transactions into your EMIs.

Yes, the Balance Transfer facility allows you to transfer existing dues from other bank cards with a credit balance transfer to your SBI credit card for a preferential interest rate. Balance transfer can help you consolidate and reduce your interest.

You should block the card hosted on the app, website, or helpline as soon as possible to ensure it cannot be used by any unauthorized person. A replacement card will be issued for a fee stated in the bank's schedule if applicable. You may wish to file a police report for additional safety if you feel it is necessary.

Yes, SBI may offer a loan to any cardholder under the Encash facility. Depending on the type of loan, cardholders could have funds within limit or outside of their credit limit. The amount approved for the loan would become your total debt. The amount of time will be based on the amount of the loan requested.

Your limit usually stays the same unless you are granted an increase by SBI at the time of your upgrade. All the points you earned with your previous credit card will be transferred to your new upgraded card. The new benefits of your card will begin once the upgraded card is produced and used.

SBI cannot directly cancel transactions after they have been authorized. You will need to contact the merchant for a reversal or raise a dispute if the charge is not accurate. If a refund is initiated by the merchant, it will show as a credit to your card.

You can redeem your points through the SBI Card app or website towards vouchers, merchandise, travel bookings, or statement credit (based on your card type). There may be minimum points that need to be redeemed. Some redemptions may include a small processing fee.

Step 1:Go to the BankBazaar website and find the SBI Credit Card section where the tracking service is available for applications. The tracking service is conveniently located on a webpage.

Step 2:Find and select the Track Application option from the tracking service. The tracking service is meant to inform applicants of their application request without contacting customer support immediately.

Step 3:Fill in the required fields including the application ID and mobile number used for the application process. The application ID and mobile number must be the same entered into the application since the information is used to identity verification and call up the application status.

Step 4:Click on the Track Application button. The system will process the information and return the most current application status such as pending review, approval, dispatched or requiring additional information.
Step 5:If you do not remember your application ID, BankBazaar has a retrieval service. You may enter your registered mobile or email to recover your application ID.

Step 1:Verify eligibility. Check if you hold a primary SBI Card, have adequate available credit, and qualify for a Balance Transfer (BT). The usual minimum amount for the transfer is Rs.5,000; the maximum is generally 75% of your available credit limit (based on cardholder eligibility requirements).

Step 2:Choose the amount and plan. Determine how much outstanding balance you want to transfer and whether you want to use the BT plan feature (short term as in the lowest interest options or BT on EMI). Check the interest rates, tenures, and processing fees applicable to you.

Step 3:Choose the booking methods. Use one of the several official SBI Card booking methods: SBI Card website (login required), SBI Card mobile application, customer-care phone, SBI Card chatbot, and SMS received from SBI Card.
Step 4:Maintain request for BT. In the Balance Transfer (or Lower Interest Options / Balance Transfer on EMI) section, maintain a new request.

Step 5:Provide beneficiary card details. Enter the 16-digit card number of your other bank’s credit card (the credit card to which the amount will be credited). You can only use your own cards as beneficiary.

Step 6:Input transfer amount and select tenure. Enter the amount to transfer (up to your eligibility limit) and then select the tenure/plan that is listed for your account; the screen will give you a monthly rate, processing fee and total repayment obligation.

Step 7:Review charges and terms. Make sure to closely review and understand the interest rate, processing fee, any one-time charge and effective EMI or repayment schedule and confirm that you agree to the terms.
Step 8:Submit a request. Complete the booking and submit; make sure to write down the acknowledgement/reference number that is displayed or you receive via SMS / E-mail.

Step 9:Processing and applying the balances. SBI Card will process your request and send the transfer to the customers card account via NEFT; usually, the processing of the request is complete in about 3 to 4 business days (excluding bank holidays) - please monitor both cards to verify that credits have been applied to the beneficiary.

Step 10:Make repayment based on the selection plan. The amount transferred will show on the SBI Card as a BT balance; you will want to make repayment based on the plan selected to avoid any additional interest or penalties.

Step 11:Follow up if applicable. Contact customer care if the amount has not been credited within the time indicated; provide your reference number and you will receive a status update and resolution.

Is it possible to request an increase in the credit limit on my SBI credit card?You can request a credit limit increase using the SBI Card App, the SBI Card website, or the customer care line, if your card was issued with the option to request this. SBI may request updated income documents and/or proof of work and/or employment unless they make you a pre-approved increase offer.

Is there a way to check my available limit, statement, and current balances?All of your information can be seen through the SBI Card mobile app, or the SBI Card website dashboard. Additionally, you can inquire about your balance via SMS and/or the customer care representative.

What are the consequences of not paying my SBI credit card bill on time?Failure to pay your bill on time will incur both a late payment fee and finance charges, based on your remaining balance. Your future interest-free period for purchases may also be negatively impacted. In addition, missing payment deadlines repeatedly can diminish your credit score.

Can I convert large transactions into EMIs using my SBI credit card?Yes, SBI allows you to convert eligible spends into instalments using the SBI Card app, the SBI Card website, or by calling the SBI Card helpline. The tenure usually ranges from 3 months to 36 months and the applicable interest and processing fee will be applicable if you convert transactions into your EMIs.

Can I transfer outstanding balances from other credit cards to my SBI credit card?Yes, the Balance Transfer facility allows you to transfer existing dues from other bank cards with a credit balance transfer to your SBI credit card for a preferential interest rate. Balance transfer can help you consolidate and reduce your interest.

What should I do if my SBI credit card disappears or is lost or stolen?You should block the card hosted on the app, website, or helpline as soon as possible to ensure it cannot be used by any unauthorized person. A replacement card will be issued for a fee stated in the bank's schedule if applicable. You may wish to file a police report for additional safety if you feel it is necessary.

Does SBI provide loans against my credit card?Yes, SBI may offer a loan to any cardholder under the Encash facility. Depending on the type of loan, cardholders could have funds within limit or outside of their credit limit. The amount approved for the loan would become your total debt. The amount of time will be based on the amount of the loan requested.

I upgraded my SBI credit card. What happens to my limit and reward points?Your limit usually stays the same unless you are granted an increase by SBI at the time of your upgrade. All the points you earned with your previous credit card will be transferred to your new upgraded card. The new benefits of your card will begin once the upgraded card is produced and used.

I made an error in a transaction. Can I cancel it or get a refund?SBI cannot directly cancel transactions after they have been authorized. You will need to contact the merchant for a reversal or raise a dispute if the charge is not accurate. If a refund is initiated by the merchant, it will show as a credit to your card.

How can I redeem my reward points that I have earned on my SBI credit card?You can redeem your points through the SBI Card app or website towards vouchers, merchandise, travel bookings, or statement credit (based on your card type). There may be minimum points that need to be redeemed. Some redemptions may include a small processing fee.
